metadata.title: CVE-2023-0494 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in X.Org. This issue occurs due to a danglingpointer in DeepCopyPointerClasses that can be exploited byProcXkbSetDeviceInfo() and ProcXkbGetDeviceInfo() to read and write intofreed memory. This can lead to local privilege elevation on systems wherethe X server runs privileged and remote code execution for ssh X forwardingsessions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0494` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xnest - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
xorg-server-source - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
xserver-common - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
xserver-xephyr - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-core - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
xserver-xorg-legacy - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
xvfb - 2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

xwayland - 2:22.1.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xorg-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:21.1.7-1ubuntu1').
xwayland package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:22.1.8-1').
